good_at: Student is engaged and motivated. Can interact easily. Asks appropriate questions. I am confident this will be a successful course

lesson_name: Company Bosses On the Prowl- Cont'd
good_at: Good at understanding the metaphors and using them in appropriate situatuons.
need_to_improve: V sound. Don't let your lips touch at all. If your lips touch it will make a P or B sound

good_at: Good at putting corrections into use. I could see that student was focusing on correct pronunciation and language points after correction.
need_to_improve: Need to improve listening, especially British accent. Remember, QU sounds like KW and the K should be strong. I heard improvement with the V sound, but keep practicing.

good_at: Good at understanding the concepts of the lesson. Good participation and engagement.
need_to_improve: Needs to improve some consonant sounds. G P and especially B need to be stronger. H sound does not need to have the vibration from the throat. Only the sound of air passing through our throat and mouth

good_at: Very motivated and engaged student. Pays attention and makes a great effort to correct mistakes. Great job today pronouncing the d í sound after a bit of practice.
need_to_improve: Now, student knows HOW to make some correct sounds but just needs to focus and practice until it becomes habit. It will take some time and effort, but I am confident student will succeed.

good_at: Good at using the vocab learned in lesson. Asks good questions. Good engagement
need_to_improve: Needs to keep practicing pronunciation, especially V sound and B sound.

good_at: Very good at using new vocabulary. Good at avoiding grammar mistakes after correction
need_to_improve: Keep working on B and V sounds

good_at: Good at praticing the language points we focused on during her mock presentations. Good at trying to find new phrases so her language is not repetitive.
need_to_improve: Needs to remember pronunciation points when not doing an activity that focuses on pronunciation. Student can pronounce the key sounds well when focusing, but often forgets when speaking naturally.

good_at: Good at following correction

good_at: Good at pronouncing the different I sounds WHEN FOCUSING. Good at understanding collocations with TEAM.
need_to_improve: Needs to practice the different I sounds so it will become habit. Student can pronounce the sounds perfectly when focusing, but in normal speaking situations may forget. Just need to build the habit.

good_at: Good at discussing the role play situations. Good at recognizing when she made a pronunciation error
need_to_improve: Needs to improve pronunciation of consonant clusters with R. PR,BR,GR etc. The first letter must be pronounced stronger.

lesson_name: Leading the Team- cont'd- Extreme internet connection problems prevented us from finishing this lesson today. We will have to finish this lesson on Wednesday.
good_at: Good at using correct phrases to agree/disagree.
need_to_improve: Adjective+ING/Adjective+ED. The thing that CAUSES a feeling is adjective+ING. The person who FEELS the feeling is adjective+ED. Example: The movie was BORING. I felt BORED when I watched the movie.

good_at: Good at using correct phrases to agree/disagree.
need_to_improve: Needs to practice long i/short i until it becomes habit

good_at: Remembered ALL of the metaphors from lesson 1. Good pronunciation of the targeted consonant sound
need_to_improve: Short I sound still needs practice, but improvement is clear.

good_at: Good job with targeted vocabulary
need_to_improve: Short  sound was still a weak point

good_at: Good job with targeted vocabulary and also with intonation for questions
need_to_improve: I heard improvement in the I sounds, but let's keep practicing

good_at: Good at question intonation and understanding question types/purposes. Also, I heard a LOT of improvement in pronunciation of the i sounds
need_to_improve: Past tense verb+ED ending pronunciation

good_at: Good use of the different question types. Good intonation of questions. Thank you for asking about pronunciations and meanings of words you weren't sure about.
need_to_improve: While I did hear correct pronunciation of the i sounds, you still made some mistakes. Let's continue to focus on that

good_at: Good at using context to find meanings of new words.
need_to_improve: Made some mistakes with syllable stress.

good_at: good at recognizing and using phrases in the different parts of a briefing
need_to_improve: Pronunciation of French borrow words. These words do not follow the standard guidelines of English pronunciatrion. TIP: a word that contains vowel+nnaire is almost always a French borrow word and we do not pronounce the final E. The stress will usually be on the last syllable.

good_at: Good at pronouncing different S final sounds when NOT thinking about it.
need_to_improve: Stressing the wrong syllable or words in a phrase. It is often difficult to know which syllable to stress, but in compound nouns, we ALMOST always stress the first word.

good_at: Good at listening, good at understanding WHY we need to use targeted phrases
need_to_improve: Needs to improve pronouns, often used wrong pronoun. Often forgot to use past tense for events in the past.

good_at: Pronunciation was nearly perfect
need_to_improve: Weak point was remembering some of the collocations we learned in the first lesson of this module.

good_at: Good at understanding the vocabulary. Good at recognizing connections between the Spanish word and English word for deeper understanding
need_to_improve: Generally does well with the stress of 2 syllable words, but often stresses the wrong syllable in longer words. Also, we should practice the P/V/B sounds again as pronunciation is slipping.

good_at: This topic is an area of expertise for Ms Erica. She already understands most of the phrases and all of the reasons to use the phrases.

good_at: Good at vocabulary. Already knew many of the target words and easily understood new words.

need_to_improve: Pronounce V a little bit stronger and hold the sound for a little bit longer. Your lips should not touch each other when you make this sound.

good_at: Strong discussions today. Very good at understanding and using different word stress to change the meaning of sentences

good_at: Much better pronunciation of P and B today

good_at: Telling stories about the future, explaining legal contracts and the 4cs. We worked well on going through the future tenses together and ensuring that Rachel had a full understanding of how to use and how to say. He is also good at sharing details about his work schedule and responsibilies to help me understand about his role.
need_to_improve: Pronounciation of words such as April and words that end in -ed such as described. We went through legal contracts together and I can see there is a gap when Rachel is trying to pronounce some words, especially those that end in -ed because he is not pronouncing the sound fully and often forgets to pronounce the letter d at the end of the word

good_at: Rachel was called into an emergency meeting
need_to_improve: Rachel was called into an emergency meeting

good_at: Rachel did very well today in correcting his pronounciation and discussing business abbreviations and legal vocabulary. We went through business meeting presentations and abbreviations together to make sure he had a full understanding which he did.
need_to_improve: We will keep checking on words he has difficulty with such as April and negligence. Whilst going through the legal vocabulary it was clear to see that some words he struggles with and needs help with so we spent time together around this. Breaking words up into seperate parts and going through the syllaballs together, then once he is comfortable with the sends, get him to speed up and prnounce the word fully such as neg-li-gence

good_at: cancelled by Rachel

Today we focused on Rachel's pronounciation with specific focus on b and p, then s and z. He was able to distinguish the difference with a number of different words and then we also did an interesting tongue twister which really got his mind working. I am pleased to see such progress being made already. We also continued the legal vocabulary with Racher picking up some useful new vocabulary such as torture
need_to_improve: Still need to focus on particular pronounciations, for example words that end in d and s because he forgets to pronounce these letters and sounds which are an essential part of the word.

good_at: Today we went through the past simple together and Rachel performed very well. He has a good understanding around speaking about events in the past and was able to speak confidently with a number of relevant examples, such as what he wore yesterday and what he did at work the day before. Regarding letters we went through the correct way to address certain people ie, Sir/Madam, Mr and person's name. Also the different ways to sign off such as best regards and yours sincerely
need_to_improve: As previously there is still a tendency to miss letters at the end of words such as the "d" and "s" sound. We practice regularly in order to help Rachel improve his pronounciation. The letters "b" and "p" can be problematic and we have already gone through a number of exercises to start combating this. Today in particular we discussed about being "bankrupt". All these sounds Rachel has struggled with to fully pronounce the word accordingly. We broke down and went through together with particular focus on the "ru" sound with another set of words with similar sounds

good_at: Today we paid particular attention to a set of words Rachel had sent to me beforehand for a detailed discussion. These words are closely linked to the legal wordings and contracts he regularly  has interaction with in his day to day activities. For example we discussed around words like installment and tranche to understand what is the difference and when they should be used. Rachel has a great level of concentration and is quick to make notes to help him with his understanding on new words and definitions.
need_to_improve: Rachel needs to practice and begin trying to use new vocabulary he has picked up in discussions. The is constant work to be done around pronounciation and that will come in time but for now we will focus on relevant words and topics that Rachel regularly interacts with to ensure he has the best understanding when performing his role at work

good_at: In today's lesson Dung talked and discussed about someone he admires who is the founder of Trung Nguyen coffee. We discussed and went through correct email etiquette which Rachel did really well at. He also sent me a semi formal email for me to read and go through together for checking. Then we progressed to more pronounciation which Rachel is starting to improve on, for example the words that end with "s" and "ed"
need_to_improve: There is still much room for improvement around pronounciation, which we spent a lot of time on today. Specifically we focused on the "k" and "g" sounds. For example Rachel was struggling to pronounce "asked" so we broke the word down to ensure he was pronouncing the "s", "k" and "ed"

good_at: We had a good lesson today with Rachel. Firstly we focus on the past progressive and past perfect which Rachel has a good grasp of already. We then spent some time going over and discussing the letters of demand, again Rachel already has a comprehensive understanding on this matter. We then moved onto pronounciation and I can see an improvement in the way Rachel is able to engage when speaking, in particular with the "ed" endings on words such as "started"
need_to_improve: There is still much room for growth and we spent a considerable amount of time on pronounciation. For example when says "sits" Rachel is actually saying "sick" so we needed to spend time to understand the difference. Also the "th" sound was a good session however the "thr" sound for words such as "three, thrown, threw and throat" needs regular practice. We engaged in a number of tongue twisters which was a useful way for Rachel to practice the sound and how he should position his tongue when trying to speak. I think with regular practice we will be able to see vast improvements over the next few weeks.

good_at: Rachel's knowledge of setting up a new business is excellent. We discussed the procedure and all the necessary steps in the process together. He was able to apply present perfect and present perfect continuous to talk about activity and results adequately. We discussed around doublets and triplets which Rachel having a sound understanding about both.
need_to_improve: Today we encountered some new challenging words with pronounciation issues such as the "gui" sound for guilty, guide and guy. We practiced the "s" and "ed" endings sounds with some signs of improvement from Rache's side. Will need regular practice as discussed to make the sounds become a habit when speaking.

good_at: We had several decent in depth discussions around changing jobs and staff retention, related specifically to Vietnam referring to first hand experiences gained. Rachel is able to talk at length on complex matters including ways of keeping staff and why staff leave due to bad bosses. His understanding around negotiation is solid and has skills gained through courses taken and work that allow him to talk eloquently around the subject. I do not detect many issues with his grammar and tenses which is good to see at present.
need_to_improve: There are still issues around words ending with "s" and "ed". We have several exercises we go through regularly to ensure Rachel understands this and when he should be pronouncing these end sounds. We also practiced the "th" and "thr" sounds as these are causing issues for him at times however I am seeing some improvements which is good to see. I also checked around words such as "because" due to feedback from HR but I do not see any major obstacles here.

good_at: Rachel shared his bucket list with much enthusiasm and interest. He was able to speak at length about some of his dreams such as building a house and opening a coffee shop for him to relax in. We also reviewed one of his current active contracts with one partner. His vocabulary and grammar is of a good standard with the correct use of present perfect and present simple. He also has understanding writing with phrasal verbs and is comfortable using them when required.
need_to_improve: Some simple grammatical mistakes are made when checking some of Rachel;s work. For exaple sometimes he forgets to add the word "the" or "of" in a sentence to give it proper meaning and flow. He just needs to double check his work and ensure he does not forget to include these when writing to give the context proper meaning and better flow. Regular practice with pronounciation is required as in the worksheets provided with specific sounds and endings.

good_at: We had a good session with Rachel around his motivations for work. He was able to clearly share his views and opinions in an articulate way which helped to build discussion and talk at length on the matter. What was interesting were his views around his team, in terms of seeing them learn, grow and develop. he also mentioned about his own feelings around company culture and environment which is important to him in regards to work motivation. He also did well in terms of speaking about the best company to work for. We used De Heus as an example and compared to the market leader CP where he was able to share his views and opinions at length.
need_to_improve: We spent some time around pronounciation to improve his speech and in particular the "sh" sound with use of choice words and sentences to get him practicing. With some sounds there are no issues at all but we regularly spend time on the difficult sayings for Rachel to help him improve. What could be useful is for him to record his own voice and then play back to himself so he can hear where he is making common mistakes and then to take note. We can also work on this together in upcoming sessions.

good_at: Rachel did well today discussing about leadership and qualities to succeed in depth. Regarding leadership he made several suitable points such as strategy, scope and career path when disucssing about being a leader and having a team. We also discussed around qualities such as performance in role and creating added value. With his pronounciation I saw a vast improvement with the "th" sound which is good to see.
need_to_improve: We practiced several sounds today that need help with pronounciation such as "ed". With regular practice, Rachel will be able to grasp these sounds correctly and is already showing signs of understanding with a number of words used in examples. The tongue twisters can cause problems at times but that is normal. Today we prcaticed the "red lorry, yellow lorry" twister at pace and repeated to test Rachel's skills. This was a useful exercise for him but he will need to practice to see improvements as mentioned.

good_at: Rachel was quick to pick up and understand a number of phrasal verbs such as "take on", "take off", "warm up to". Using specific examples was able to help his understanding and knowledge and he did well around the whole topic. We also had a short session around the UK and specific sayings and words you are likely to hear from English people which again he was able to pick up well and then provide his own thoughts and feelings that helped him to understand.
need_to_improve: Prounciation is key for him to focus on. There is improvement with his "ed" and "s" ending words and he continues to practice with motivation. The tongue twisters are still proving difficult at times and this was coveyed when trying the "red lorry, yellow lorry" exercise which requires him to repeat the same words and at speed.

good_at: Rachel was good at making the association between British and American legal terms such as "counsel" and barrister. We spent some time using specific examples so Rachel was able to discuss his roles and duties at work by using specific vocabulary such "wills" and "clientele". He did well when discussing the differences betweeen legal terms and asked questions when needed exta help and detail.
need_to_improve: Rachel can spend some time reviewing the legal terms and then discuss which words and phrases he has difficulty with such as "criminal" and suspect. He has some homework to generate some leading topics for our next lesson on Thursday to discuss any terms he doesn't understand or needs help with the meaning and definition.

good_at: Rachel cancelled today's lesson
